evidence: Compressive engineering stress vs. engineering strain curves for the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy are illustrated in Fig.  1 . During testing at room temperature (RT, 23 C), the alloy yielded at s 0.2 ¼ 1058 MPa, showed a maximum strength, s m , of 1211 MPa at 3 p ¼ 0.95%, and failed by splitting at 3 p ¼ 2.1% (Fig.  1a ). Here 3 p is the plastic strain, s 0.2 is the yield stress at 3 p ¼ 0.2%. After correcting for machine compliance, the compression modulus, E comp , was determined to be E comp ¼ 220 AE 20 GPa. This resulted in the total elastic strain, 3 e , just before the fracture, of 3 e ¼ 0.52% and an accumulated elastic energy per unit volume W ¼ 2970 AE 270 kJ/m 3 .

microstructure: BCC crystal structure, finer grain size, dendritic structure, uneven Z-contrast inside the grains indicates slightly different compositions of dendritic and interdendritic regions due to constitutional segregation during solidification
evidence: The compression modulus was E comp ¼ 180 AE 15 GPa, which resulted in 3 e z 0.60% and W ¼ 3260 AE 330 kJ/m 3 at the fracture point (s f ¼ 1087 MPa). An increase in temperature to 600 C decreased the yield stress to s 0.2 ¼ 862 MPa, but increased total compressive failure strain to 3 f z 13%

microstructure: BCC crystal structure, average grain size 200 mm, non-uniform grain size distribution, larger grains in regions experiencing slower cooling during solidification, dendritic structure, uneven Z-contrast inside the grains indicates slightly different compositions of dendritic and interdendritic regions due to constitutional segregation during solidification
evidence: The yield stress values of the refractory HEAs are much higher than those of Haynes 230 at all studied temperatures and higher than those of Inconel 718 at temperatures above 800 C. For example, YS decreases from 561 to 405 MPa for the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy and from 862 to 470 MPa for the V 20 Nb 20 Mo 20 Ta 20 W 20 alloy in this temperature range.

microstructure: large grains compressed along the loading direction, dendritic structure retained
evidence: In the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy, the yield stress was 561 MPa at 600 C and it continuously decreased with temperature down to 405 MPa at 1600 C. The V 20 Nb 20 Mo 20 Ta 20 W 20 alloy was w200 MPa stronger in the temperature range of 600 C e 1200 C. However, the yield stress of the V 20 Nb 20 Mo 20 Ta 20 W 20 alloy decreased more rapidly than that of the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy in the temperature range of 1200 C e 1600 C, so that its yield stress at 1600 C (477 MPa) was close to that of the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy (405 MPa). While near-steady state flow occurred at 1200e1600 C in the Nb 25 Mo 25 Ta 25 W 25 alloy, the V 20 Nb 20 Mo 20 Ta 20 W 20 alloy showed
